10 Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, have I purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance, that the name of the dead not be cut off from among his brothers, and from the gate of his place: you are witnesses this day.Ruth 4:10
Stats
Rank: #7440 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 260 characters, 46 words, 202 letters, 81 vowels, 121 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אֶת־ר֣וּת הַמֹּאֲבִיָּה֩ אֵ֨שֶׁת מַחְלֹ֜ון קָנִ֧יתִי לִ֣י לְאִשָּׁ֗ה לְהָקִ֤ים שֵׁם־הַמֵּת֙ עַל־נַ֣חֲלָתֹ֔ו וְלֹא־יִכָּרֵ֧ת שֵׁם־הַמֵּ֛ת מֵעִ֥ם אֶחָ֖יו וּמִשַּׁ֣עַר מְקֹומֹ֑ו עֵדִ֥ים אַתֶּ֖ם הַיֹּֽום׃

Lit: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess the widow of Mahlon I have acquired my as wife to raise up the name of the dead through his inheritance that not may be cut off the name of the dead from among his brothers and from at the gate his position witnesses You are this day

KJV: Moreover Ruth the Moabitess, the wife of Mahlon, have I purchased to be my wife, to raise up the name of the dead upon his inheritance, that the name of the dead be not cut off from among his brethren, and from the gate of his place: ye are witnesses this day.
References

"have I"
Ge 29:18: 19: 27: Jacob loved Rachel; and said: I will serve you 7 years for Rachel your younger daughter.
Pr 18:22: Whoever finds'>finds a wife finds'>finds a good thing: and obtains favour of the LORD.
Pr 19:14: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.
Pr 31:10: 11: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
Ho 3:2: So I bought her to me for 15 pieces of silver: and for an homer of barley: and an half homer of barley:
Ho 12:12: Jacob fled into the country of Syria: and Israel served for a wife: and for a wife he kept sheep.
Eph 5:25: Husbands: love your wives: even as Christ also loved the church: and gave Himself for it;

"the name"
De 25:6: It will be: that the firstborn which she bears will succeed in the name of his brother which is dead: that his name not be put out of Israel.
Jos 7:9: For the Canaanites and all the inhabitants of the land will hear of it: and will environ us round: and cut off our name from the earth: and what will you do to your great name?
Ps 34:16: The face of the LORD is against them that do evil: to cut off the remembrance of them from the earth.
Ps 109:15: Let them be before the LORD continually: that He may cut off the memory of them from the earth.
Isa 48:19: Your seed also had been as the sand: and the offspring of your bowels like the gravel thereof; his name not should have been cut off nor destroyed from before me.
Zec 13:2: It will come to pass in that day: says the LORD of hosts: that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land: and they will no more be remembered: and also I will cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land.

"ye are witnesses"
Isa 8:2: 3: I took to me faithful witnesses to record: Uriah the priest: and Zechariah the son of Jeberechiah.
Mal 2:14: Yet you say: For what reason? Because the LORD has been witness between you and the wife of your youth: against whom you have dealt treacherously: yet is she your companion: and the wife of your covenant.
Heb 13:4: Marriage is honourable in all: and the bed undefiled: but whoremongers and adulterers God will judge.

H8034שֵׁ֖םšêm   (N-ms)
H8034 שֵׁם shêm shame a primitive word (perhaps rather from through the idea of definite and conspicuous position; compare שָׁמַיִם); an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character; phrase base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report. 		שֵׁ֖םšêm be famous N-ms

H1035לָֽחֶם׃lā-ḥem.   (Prep | N-proper-fs)
H1035 בֵּית לֶחֶם Bêyth Lechem bayth leh-khem from בַּיִת and לֶחֶם; house of bread; Beth-Lechem, a place in Palestine; Bethlehem. 		לָֽחֶם׃lā-ḥem. Bethlehem Prep | N-proper-fs
11 All the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, We are witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into your house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do you worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:Ruth 4:11
Stats
Rank: #6208 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 267 characters, 43 words, 207 letters, 84 vowels, 123 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמְר֜וּ כָּל־הָעָ֧ם אֲשֶׁר־בַּשַּׁ֛עַר וְהַזְּקֵנִ֖ים עֵדִ֑ים יִתֵּן֩ יְהוָ֨ה אֶֽת־הָאִשָּׁ֜ה הַבָּאָ֣ה אֶל־בֵּיתֶ֗ךָ כְּרָחֵ֤ל ׀ וּכְלֵאָה֙ אֲשֶׁ֨ר בָּנ֤וּ שְׁתֵּיהֶם֙ אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וַעֲשֵׂה־חַ֣יִל בְּאֶפְרָ֔תָה וּקְרָא־שֵׁ֖ם בְּבֵ֥ית לָֽחֶם׃

Lit: And said all the people who were at the gate and the elders We are witnesses Make Yahweh the woman who is coming to your house like Rachel and Leah who built the two the house of Israel and may you prosper in Ephrathah and be famous in Bethlehem

KJV: And all the people that were in the gate, and the elders, said, [We are] witnesses. The LORD make the woman that is come into thine house like Rachel and like Leah, which two did build the house of Israel: and do thou worthily in Ephratah, and be famous in Bethlehem:
References

"the Lord"
Ge 24:60: They blessed Rebekah: and said to her: You are our sister: be you the mother of thousands of millions: and let your seed possess the gate of those which hate them.
Ps 127:3-5: Indeed: children are an heritage of the LORD: and the fruit of the womb is His reward.
Ps 128:3-6: Your wife will be as a fruitful vine by the sides of your house: your children like olive plants round about your table.

"Rachel"
Ge 29:32-35: Leah conceived: and bare a son: and she called His name Reuben: for she said: Surely the LORD has looked upon my affliction; now therefore my husband will love me.
Ge 30:1-24: When Rachel saw that she bare Jacob no children: Rachel envied her sister; and said to Jacob: Give me children: or else I die.
Ge 35:16-20: They journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed: and she had hard labour.
Ge 46:8-27: These are the names of the children of Israel: which came into Egypt: Jacob and his sons: Reuben: Jacob's firstborn.
Nu 26:1-65: It came to pass after the plague: that the LORD spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest: saying:

"build"
De 25:9: Then will his brother's wife come to him in the presence of the elders: and loose his shoe from off his foot: and spit in his face: and will answer and say: So will it be done to that man that not will build up his brother's house.
Pr 14:1: Every wise woman builds her house: but the foolish plucks it down with her hands.

"Ephratah"
Ru 1:2: The name of the man was Elimelech: and the name of his wife Naomi: and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion: Ephrathites of Bethlehemjudah. And they came into the country of Moab: and continued there.
Ge 35:16: 19: They journeyed from Bethel; and there was but a little way to come to Ephrath: and Rachel travailed: and she had hard labour.
Ps 132:6: Indeed: we heard of it at Ephratah: we found it in the fields of the wood.
Mic 5:2: But you: Bethlehem Ephratah: though you be little among the thousands of Judah: yet out of you will he come forth to me that is to be ruler in Israel; whose goings forth have been from of old: from everlasting.
Mt 2:6: you Bethlehem: in the land of Juda: are not the least among the princes of Juda: for out of you will come a Governor: that will rule my people Israel.

 וִיהִ֤י בֵֽיתְךָ֙ כְּבֵ֣ית פֶּ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה תָמָ֖ר לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה מִן־הַזֶּ֗רַע אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֤ן יְהוָה֙ לְךָ֔ מִן־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃

12 Let your house be like the house of Pharez, whom Tamar bare to Judah, of the seed which the LORD will give you of this young woman.Ruth 4:12

Translation
Hebrew: וִיהִ֤י בֵֽיתְךָ֙ כְּבֵ֣ית פֶּ֔רֶץ אֲשֶׁר־יָלְדָ֥ה תָמָ֖ר לִֽיהוּדָ֑ה מִן־הַזֶּ֗רַע אֲשֶׁ֨ר יִתֵּ֤ן יְהוָה֙ לְךָ֔ מִן־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֖ה הַזֹּֽאת׃

Lit: May be your house like the house of Perez whom bore Tamar to Judah because of the offspring which will give Yahweh you from young woman this

KJV: And let thy house be like the house of Pharez, whom Tamar bare unto Judah, of the seed which the LORD shall give thee of this young woman.
References

"the house"
Ge 46:12: The sons of Judah; Er: and Onan: and Shelah: and Pharez: and Zerah: but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Pharez were Hezron and Hamul.
Nu 26:20-22: The sons of Judah after their families were; of Shelah: the family of the Shelanites: of Pharez: the family of the Pharzites: of Zerah: the family of the Zarhites.

"whom"
Ge 38:29: It came to pass: as he drew back his hand: that: look: his brother came out: and she said: How have you broken forth? this breach be upon you: therefore his name was called Pharez.
1Ch 2:4: Tamar his daughter in law bare him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were 5.
Mt 1:3: Judas begot Phares and Zara of Thamar; and Phares begot Esrom; and Esrom begot Aram;

"of the seed"
1Sa 2:20: Eli blessed Elkanah and His wife: and said: The LORD give you seed of this woman for the loan which is lent to the LORD. And they went to their own home.

Boaz Marries Ruth

וַיִּקַּ֨ח בֹּ֤עַז אֶת־רוּת֙ וַתְּהִי־לֹ֣ו לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהוָ֥ה לָ֛הּ הֵרָיֹ֖ון וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּֽן׃

H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		בֵּֽן׃bên. a son N-ms
13 So Boaz took Ruth, and she was His wife: and when He went in to her, the LORD gave her conception, and she bare a son.Ruth 4:13
Stats
Counts: 120 characters, 22 words, 90 letters, 35 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַיִּקַּ֨ח בֹּ֤עַז אֶת־רוּת֙ וַתְּהִי־לֹ֣ו לְאִשָּׁ֔ה וַיָּבֹ֖א אֵלֶ֑יהָ וַיִּתֵּ֨ן יְהוָ֥ה לָ֛הּ הֵרָיֹ֖ון וַתֵּ֥לֶד בֵּֽן׃

Lit: So took Boaz Ruth and she became his wife and when he went in to her and gave Yahweh her conception and she bore a son

KJV: So Boaz took Ruth, and she was his wife: and when he went in unto her, the LORD gave her conception, and she bare a son.

14 The women said to Naomi, Blessed be the LORD, which has not left you this day without a kinsman, that His name may be famous in Israel.Ruth 4:14
Stats
Rank: #8690 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 143 characters, 25 words, 112 letters, 43 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וַתֹּאמַ֤רְנָה הַנָּשִׁים֙ אֶֽל־נָעֳמִ֔י בָּר֣וּךְ יְהוָ֔ה אֲ֠שֶׁר לֹ֣א הִשְׁבִּ֥ית לָ֛ךְ גֹּאֵ֖ל הַיֹּ֑ום וְיִקָּרֵ֥א שְׁמֹ֖ו בְּיִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃

Lit: And said the women to Naomi Blessed be Yahweh who not has left you without a kinsman-redeemer this day and may be famous his name in Israel

KJV: And the women said unto Naomi, Blessed be the LORD, which hath not left thee this day without a kinsman, that his name may be famous in Israel.

H1931הִיא֙hî   (Pro-3fs)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הִיא֙hî is Pro-3fs
H2896ט֣וֹבָהṭō-w-ḇāh   (Adj-fs)
H2896 טוֹב ṭôwb tobe from טוֹב; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well); beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, idiom fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, idiom most, pleasant, phrase pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured)., 		ט֣וֹבָהṭō-w-ḇāh better Adj-fs

H7651מִשִּׁבְעָ֖הmiš-šiḇ-‘āh   (Prep-m | Number-ms)
H7651 שֶׁבַע shebaʻ sheh-bah or (masculine) (שִׁבְעָה); from שָׁבַע; a primitive cardinal number; seven (as the sacred full one); also (adverbially) seven times; by implication, a week; by extension, an indefinite number; (phrase by) seven(-fold),-s, (-teen, -teenth), -th, times). H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		בָּנִֽים׃bā-nîm. sons N-mp
15 He will be to you a restorer of your life, and a nourisher of your old age: for your daughter in law, which loves you, which is better to you than 7 sons, has born him.Ruth 4:15
Stats
Rank: #8416 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 183 characters, 32 words, 141 letters, 52 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהָ֤יָה לָךְ֙ לְמֵשִׁ֣יב נֶ֔פֶשׁ וּלְכַלְכֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׂיבָתֵ֑ךְ כִּ֣י כַלָּתֵ֤ךְ אֲ‍ֽשֶׁר־אֲהֵבַ֙תֶךְ֙ יְלָדַ֔תּוּ אֲשֶׁר־הִיא֙ טֹ֣ובָה לָ֔ךְ מִשִּׁבְעָ֖ה בָּנִֽים׃

Lit: And may he be to you a restorer of life and a nourisher of your old age for your daughter-in-law who loves you has borne him who is better to you than seven sons

KJV: And he shall be unto thee a restorer of thy life, and a nourisher of thine old age: for thy daughter in law, which loveth thee, which is better to thee than seven sons, hath born him.
References

"a nourisher, etc"
Ge 45:11: There will I nourish you; for yet there are 5 years of famine; lest you: and your household: and all that you have: come to poverty.
Ge 47:12: Joseph nourished his father: and his brothers: and all his father's household: with bread: according to their families.
Ps 55:22: Cast your burden upon the LORD: and He will sustain you: He will never suffer the righteous to be moved.
Isa 46:4: even to your old age I am he; and even to hoar hairs will I carry you: I have made: and I will bear; even I will carry: and will deliver you.

"for thy"
Ru 1:16-18: Ruth said: Intreat not me to leave you: or to return from following after you: for whither you go: I will go; and where you lodge: I will lodge: your people will be my people: and your God my God:

"better"
1Sa 1:8: Then said Elkanah her husband to her: Hannah: why weep you? and why eat you not? and why is your heart grieved? am not I better to you than 10 sons?
Pr 18:24: A man that has friends must show himself friendly: and there is a friend that sticks closer than a brother.

H2696וְחֶצְרוֹן֙wə-ḥeṣ-rō-wn   (Conj-w | N-proper-ms)
H2696 חֶצְרוֹן Chetsrôwn khets-rone from חָצֵר; court-yard; Chetsron, the name of a place in Palestine; also of two Israelites; Hezron., 		וְחֶצְרוֹן֙wə-ḥeṣ-rō-wn and Hezron Conj-w | N-proper-ms
H3205הוֹלִ֣ידhō-w-lîḏ   (V-Hifil-Perf-3ms)
H3205 יָלַד yâlad yaw-lad a primitive root; to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage; bear, beget, birth(-day), born, (make to) bring forth (children, young), bring up, calve, child, come, be delivered (of a child), time of delivery, gender, hatch, labour, (do the office of a) midwife, declare pedigrees, be the son of, (woman in, woman that) travail(-eth, -ing woman). 		הוֹלִ֣ידhō-w-lîḏ begat V-Hifil-Perf-3ms
H7410רָ֔םrām,   (N-proper-ms)
H7410 רָם Râm rawm active participle of רוּם; high; Ram, the name of an Arabian and of an Israelite; Ram. See also בֵּית הָרָם. 		רָ֔םrām, Ram N-proper-ms
H7410וְרָ֖םwə-rām   (Conj-w | N-proper-ms)
H7410 רָם Râm rawm active participle of רוּם; high; Ram, the name of an Arabian and of an Israelite; Ram. See also בֵּית הָרָם. 		וְרָ֖םwə-rām and Ram Conj-w | N-proper-ms

H5992עַמִּֽינָדָֽב׃‘am-mî-nā-ḏāḇ.   (N-proper-ms)
H5992 עַמִּינָדָב ʻAmmîynâdâb am-mee-naw-dawb from עַם and נָדַב; people of liberality; Amminadab, the name of four Israelites; Amminadab. 		עַמִּֽינָדָֽב׃‘am-mî-nā-ḏāḇ. Amminadab N-proper-ms
19 Hezron begot Ram, and Ram begot Amminadab,Ruth 4:19
Stats
Counts: 46 characters, 7 words, 37 letters, 14 vowels, 23 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְחֶצְרֹון֙ הֹולִ֣יד אֶת־רָ֔ם וְרָ֖ם הֹולִ֥יד אֶת־עַמִּֽינָדָֽב׃

Lit: and Hezron begat Ram and Ram begat Amminadab

KJV: And Hezron begat Ram, and Ram begat Amminadab,
References

"begat Ram"
1Ch 2:9: 10: The sons also of Hezron: that were born to him; Jerahmeel: and Ram: and Chelubai.
Mt 1:4: Aram begot Aminadab; and Aminadab begot Naasson; and Naasson begot Salmon;
Lu 3:33: Which was the son of Aminadab: which was the son of Aram: which was the son of Esrom: which was the son of Phares: which was the son of Juda:

וְעַמִּֽינָדָב֙ הֹולִ֣יד אֶת־נַחְשֹׁ֔ון וְנַחְשֹׁ֖ון הֹולִ֥יד אֶת־שַׂלְמָֽה׃

H8009 שַׂלְמָה Salmâh sal-maw the same as שַׂלְמָה; clothing; Salmah, an Israelite; Salmon. Compare שַׂלְמוֹן. 		שַׂלְמָֽה׃śal-māh. Salmon N-proper-ms

Stats
Rank: #9828 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 54 characters, 7 words, 45 letters, 16 vowels, 29 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעַמִּֽינָדָב֙ הֹולִ֣יד אֶת־נַחְשֹׁ֔ון וְנַחְשֹׁ֖ון הֹולִ֥יד אֶת־שַׂלְמָֽה׃

Lit: and Amminadab begat Nahshon and Nahshon begat Salmon

KJV: And Amminadab begat Nahshon, and Nahshon begat Salmon,
References

"Nahshon"

Mt 1:4: Aram begot Aminadab; and Aminadab begot Naasson; and Naasson begot Salmon;
Lu 3:32: Which was the son of Jesse: which was the son of Obed: which was the son of Booz: which was the son of Salmon: which was the son of Naasson:

Stats

Translation
Hebrew: וְשַׂלְמֹון֙ הֹולִ֣יד אֶת־בֹּ֔עַז וּבֹ֖עַז הֹולִ֥יד אֶת־עֹובֵֽד׃

Lit: and Salmon begat Boaz and Boaz begat Obed

KJV: And Salmon begat Boaz, and Boaz begat Obed,
References

"Salmon"
1Ch 2:11: Nahshon begot Salma: and Salma begot Boaz:

"Salma"
Mt 1:5: Salmon begot Booz of Rachab; and Booz begot Obed of Ruth; and Obed begot Jesse;
Lu 3:32: Which was the son of Jesse: which was the son of Obed: which was the son of Booz: which was the son of Salmon: which was the son of Naasson:

"and Boaz"
1Ch 2:12: Boaz begot Obed: and Obed begot Jesse:
Mt 1:5: Salmon begot Booz of Rachab; and Booz begot Obed of Ruth; and Obed begot Jesse;
Lu 3:32: Which was the son of Jesse: which was the son of Obed: which was the son of Booz: which was the son of Salmon: which was the son of Naasson:

22 Obed begot Jesse, and Jesse begot David.Ruth 4:22
Stats
Rank: #9641 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 44 characters, 7 words, 35 letters, 14 vowels, 21 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְעֹבֵד֙ הֹולִ֣יד אֶת־יִשָׁ֔י וְיִשַׁ֖י הֹולִ֥יד אֶת־דָּוִֽד׃

Lit: and Obed begat Jesse and Jesse begat David

KJV: And Obed begat Jesse, and Jesse begat David.
References

"Jesse"
1Sa 16:1: The LORD said to Samuel: How long will you mourn for Saul: seeing I have rejected Him from reigning over Israel? fill your horn with oil: and go: I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite: for I have provided me a king among His sons.
Isa 11:1: There will come forth a rod out of the stem of Jesse: and a Branch will grow out of his roots:

"David"
1Ch 2:15: Ozem the sixth: David the seventh:
Mt 1:6: Jesse begot David the king; and David the king begot Solomon of her that had been the wife of Urias;
Lu 3:31: Which was the son of Melea: which was the son of Menan: which was the son of Mattatha: which was the son of Nathan: which was the son of David:
